algorithm_technique: Sorting and greedy assignment of tasks to processors
problem_summary_simple: Minimize total time by assigning tasks to processors with 4 cores each.
problem_summary_technical: Sort processors by availability and tasks by duration (descending), then greedily assign the longest tasks to the earliest available processors.
key_insights: To minimize the maximum completion time, we should pair the slowest processors with the shortest tasks and the fastest processors with the longest tasks.
Sorting both processor times and task times is key to a greedy approach.
The problem can be simplified by realizing that each processor will handle 4 tasks, and we want to minimize the maximum of (processor_time + task_time) across all processors.
